description.narrative:
CORPORACION RECONCILIACION COLOMBIA har ansökt om finansiering av 13 miljoner SEK från Sida för att genomföra projektet ” “Challenge Fund-Innovations for peace and reconciliation” under perioden 1 januari 2016-31 december 2018.
Projektet syftar till att förbättra den ekonomiska situationen för kvinnor och män som drabbats av konflikter eller som befinner sig i konfliktdrabbade områden.
Projektets totala budget är 13 miljoner SEK, varav Sverige kommer att bidra med 100%.

CORPORACION RECONCILIACION COLOMBIA has applied to Sida for funding of 13 million SEK to carry out the project “Challenge Fund-Innovations for peace and reconciliation” for the period 1 January 2016 - 31 December 2018 The project aims at improving economic situation for women and men affected by conflict or in conflict affected regions. The project total budget is 13 million SEK, of which Sweden will contribute with the 100%.

This contribution is a challenge fund that aims at improving sustainable economic situation for women and men affected by conflict or in conflict affected regions by building capacity, increase access to finance, support of the business model and developing market linkages. It is aim at channeling resources for the development of innovations of business models that link people and regions affected by the conflict. The key is that the initiatives links innovation with peace building and cannot be financed otherwise. Thus, the fund aims to provide start up investments and this be a successful business catalyst.

description.narrative: This project implemented the “Challenge Fund: Innovations for peace and reconciliation” as an instrument for private sector collaboration. The general assessment is that this instrument was good practice and an incentive for innovation and entrepreneurial start-ups in conflict-affected regions. Two calls for proposals were made in 2016 and 2017 and 514 proposals were received (210 in 2016 and 304 in 2017) 27 of which were selected. In addition, in alliance with Fundación El Nogal Foundation, 4 young entrepreneurs also received support from the fund. Hence, during the whole activity period (2016-2019) CRC supported 31 entrepreneurs in 32 municipalities from 17 Departments and 3,117 people (including 1,326 women representing 43% of participants) directly benefited with an average 30% increase in income and an average 25% increase in profitability. 45% of the projects were agribusiness, 13% dairy products, 13% fishing projects, 7% honeybee projects, 3% poultry production, 3% animal food production and 16% textile or cosmetic projects. The 31 supported companies, (12 in the first call and 19 in the second call) received tailor-made contributions that included innovation in their supply chain, production or commercialization processes. All the initiatives also received legal and financial support to strengthen their: organizations as associations or companies; organizing budgets; accounting systems; and their fiscal responsibilities. Sweden contributed through grants a total of COP $1,904,365,734 amongst 19 of the 31 companies and other donors, USAID-ACDI-VOCA and the biggest Colombian oil company- ECOPETROL, joined the fund for the second call in 2017: USAID contributed COP $913,746,059 amongst 7 companies and Ecopetrol contributed COP $503,254,101 amongst 5 companies. The leveraged amount of private resources was COP $2,663,222,780 equivalent to 44.5% of the total budget. As a complementary effort to the challenge fund, the Embassy of Sweden signed the first guarantee with a commercial bank (Bancompartir) by the end of 2018, with the aim of facilitating loans and financial services from Bancompartir to micro-, small- and medium-sized rural and urban-based enterprises, women-owned business, and targeted beneficiary populations, that can also be some of the selected entrepreneurs. The guarantee is aimed at being a new step in the gradual improvement process for all these entrepreneurs/ associations/ companies that have received seed capital through the Challenge Fund and are now prepared for incurring indebtedness. Last year, coordination with Bancompartir to use the guarantee was prioritized. On the 25th of July 2019 a first training session on general finance was held in Bogota for representatives of the 31 entrepreneurs. Between September 2019 and December 2019, 7 companies received specific financial education training sessions in their regions with the participation of 88 people in total. The Embassy will monitor the tailor-made support that is planned by the bank for each initiative in order to provide loans in conjunction with the Swedish guarantee.
